name: Condes de Barcelona

reviews.title: ok, but wait till you hear the rest......
reviews.text: This hotel is ordinary in every way, nothing special about it at all. What really irks me is their service!

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: After an overnight flight, we arrived jet lagged and exhausted looking to check in a little early. After saying our rooms were not ready, would we like to look at some other rooms? Dying to lay down and sleep a bit, we said show us anything you have. Big mistake! They gave us rooms that were available, never saying the rate on these "available rooms" would be alot more than the prepaid rooms we had booked.

reviews.title: A good place to stay
reviews.text: After a big fight at check out, they did honor the original rate quoted, but at a big embarssment to us having to "fight it out" with the staff. Stay at the Neri instead, they treat guests well there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Very stylish, ala the W hotel. Our room was quiet (with the balcony door closed) even though it was on the second floor facing Passeig de Gracia. Very comfy beds. Luxurious bath towels. Great location. Good value at $225/night.
reviews.title: very nice experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Lack of AC made sleeping uncomfortable one night because it was warm that day. Had to pay for internet service. Maid service didn't replace shampoo/conditioner even though we were very low on both, resulting in our running out of products. Some front desk staff were hurried and brusk.
reviews.title: Love the Condes in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: We have just come back from a five night stay at the Condes de Barcelona and can't recommend it highly enough. We were lucky enough to be staying in the older building and were upgraded on arrival. The room was spacious, clean and beautifully designed. We were on the main road which was a bit noisy first thing in the morning but this didn't bother us too much. We thought the location was perfect, within walking distance to most of the main attractions and very close to two Metro stations. We didn't eat at the hotel but they have a new restaurant which has had great reviews so could be worth a try. If we visit Barcelona again we would definitely stay here,
reviews.title: Modern boutique hotel in a classic building
Beautiful Building
reviews.text: I love the way European designers can take a classic old building, give it a sleek, modern interior, and make the whole thing work. That has happened at the Condes de Barcelona.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: (The hotel occupies two buildings, one on either side of Carrer Mallorca. We stayed in the one on the westerly side and did not see anything of the other building.)
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel/Annoying Staff with Attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading previous reviews of this property I was a little dissappointed to find my room was allocated in the newer wing of the hotel. I needn't have been, the room was very well appointed, clean and comfortable. The staff were efficient and courteous. The Bulgari toiletries were an added bonus!
reviews.title: Nice property, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is perhaps it's main selling point, surrounded by upmarket shops and restaurants, it is just a 10 minute walk down the Passeig de Gracia to the Plaza de Catalunya and the top of the Ramblas and the Gothic quarter. 15 minutes in the other direction up the Passeig is the Gracia district itself, full of great little restaurants and bars. Walking straight up the Calle de Majorca brings you to the Sagrada de Familia in less than 15 minutes also.
reviews.title: Super clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on the train from BCN airport which cost less than 3 Euros each, much cheaper than a taxi! The hotel is near to major underground and local train stations on the Passeig de Gracia, and lots of major bus routes, so getting further afield is not a problem.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Provided you don't pay full rack rate for this hotel, and get a good discounted price, you should book with confidence!
reviews.title: Best Location - Lovely Hotel

likes.disliked: — No one serving drinks on the Roof Terrace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Super hotel in a great location. Couldn't have been more comfortable. The room was very clean with a super big bed which was very comfortable and had lovely sheets and pillows. The balcony overlooked the Passeig de Gracia but was very quiet because of the double doors and blackout curtains.The bathroom was very clean with a great shower room and even had a telephone by the loo?? The staff were a big brusque but helpful if treated right. Would stay there again without a doubt
reviews.title: Very lazy and unfriendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't beat this hotel for location in an area which feels safer than some others. Staff are delightful and appear genuinely pleased to see you. Rooms very cool and minimalist and the most soundproofed I have ever experienced - we were opposite a lift and didn't hear it once. No doors banged and together with very comfortable beds made for a great nights sleep. Took us two days to work out how to operate the blinds! Surrounded by designer shops convenient to train/metro station, tourist bus stop very close. Lovely coffee/tea shop accross the road. We ate in Lasarte one night which was an amazing experience. Breakfast in the hotel bistro was more than adequate - great range although I did wish they had churros and chocolate. We loved this hotel and would very happily stay there again.
reviews.title: Superb location, lovely helpful staff and wonderful beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arrived late on monday evening, showed to our room, lovely,clean.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great location..... walk everywhere we wanted to, beautiful hotel, stunning location, could not have bettered if we had paid 4 times the price...definately coming back
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had book an executive room and really could not have been happier. The room was a great size, had a good size desk, free internet and had a lovely balcony too. The bathroom was a very good size and really enjoyed the deep bath. Separate rain shower and double sinks.
reviews.title: 3rd time - love it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bed was very comfortable, staff were very friendly and is next door to a GREAT tapas restaurant. Could not fault this hotel at all.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel was in a very good location and reasonably priced (got it for $110 Euros per night on the hotel's website). Large rooms, good service. Yes, the pool was tiny, but we didn't use it so it wasn't a big deal. Would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Very Solid Property, Good Location
Misleading
reviews.text: The first thing we discovered was there are two buildings - the old and the new. We had booked this hotel because of it's great location and because it had free internet access in-room and a small outdoor pool. We checked in and were met with a flustered front desk person, followed by a gesture that we were in the 'other' building across the street (the one with no pool). We clarified that we could still use the pool, so that was OK. Next, we needed the password for the internet access. That's when we discovered that you actually only get 1 hour per day of access in the lobby. If you want internet in your room, they charge an outrageous amount per 24 hour period. We went to talk to the front desk - waited a full half hour, got what we thought was a Manager, who 'checked our story' on the website while we waited - only to see for herself that there is no mention of internet service surcharges. She had to ask her Manager and would call us in 10 minutes. An hour later, we went to find her Manager - got a 'Front Desk Manager' who argued the fine points and the fact that not all hotels say they surcharge for internet access, but many actually do charge. He wouldn't give in, so we asked to speak to the Manager (so many managers and yet such poor service). He couldn't accommodate us, but said we should ask him at the end of the day what their decision was. Ultimately, the 'best offer' was half price for internet access, which we took because we needed it. So, long story short - a great location, OK room and terrible service that actually seems to forget that service is what they are supposed to provide. End of story. Won't be back to this property again.

reviews.title: Not overly impressed
reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend in late May. This is an average business hotel, nothing more. Rooms on the road side (Passeig de Gracia) are very noisy. Location is very central for some good shopping, but the hotel's common areas are quite dull and the staff aren't particulary welcoming. There are better hotels and certainly better value hotels in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Based largely upon the reviews we read here on Tripadvisor we booked four nights in late March of this year at the Condes de Barcelona. There were absolutely NO surprises - this site really works! If there are enough responses, you can get a good feel for what a hotel is really like (can see through the mindless positives, the whiner negatives, and identify those who are giving you the straight stuff).
reviews.title: Great Value in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given a 'Design' room in the newer part of the hotel and away from the busy street, as requested. It was stylishly furnished with a super bathroom and the beds had soft mattress toppers. (Only complaint was that, as so often happens, the duvets were too hot.) The staff were pleasant and helpful and we enjoyed a meal in the Loidi Restaurant, although expensive, with no option but the set 4 course menu. I chose this hotel for its position near Gaudi Buildings on Paseo de Gracia with the shops and Metro a few steps away.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in prime position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a really good deal on the rooms at this hotel and, therefore, it was worth what we paid for it. However, I would have been dissapointed if we had payed full price for this. We went in january which I know is not in season however, the terraces were closed and the pools were not open. They were also doing refurbishment works to one of the terraces, none of this was really communicated until you checked in.
reviews.title: Good location but it's not all that

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a reasonable size as we had one at the end of a corridor and the bed was comfy. The bathrooms however, need some updating, they were tired and not in the best condition. Also be warned if you stay on the front of the hotel, the spanish like to beep their horns and this can be disturbing.
reviews.title: Great if you're only looking for spending nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been to Barcelona for the first time with my wife at September'10 and our only need was a perfectly located hotel with good rooms. Yes, this hotel the one we were looking for.
reviews.title: Funky modern hotel, good service, good for high end shops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our time mostly exploring the city so a hotel like our apartment was good enough for us. The Hotel is not a highly-polished touristic place and gives you a feel that you're returning your home after a long and tiring day. We stayed at a business room which is large enough and very clean. Sleep quality was fantastic and I fell in love with the pillows and the puff :) The staff is always there to help you but you don't see their presence if you do not want to, which is nice to me.
reviews.title: Average in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located, at a great street. There're 2 buildings, one that is very nice, great rooms, and the other is terrible! Breakfast is served at the bad building, but it's ok. A bit of excess of formality. Like a business hotel.
reviews.title: Good room if you stay at the good building
great hotel
reviews.text: The hotel booked me and my husband at the bad building. The room had a very strange decoration, too modern and cold for us. There was a huge window that we'd have to take care with the curtins, or the other rooms could see us. The TV was a brand new one, but it didn't work. And the worst was the bathoom that didn't have a shower!! Just a bath tub.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We imediatly complain about the room, but the personal stuff didn't believe us! They kept laughing on us! So we call the manager and showed him the room. Only then, he ordered the stuff that change our room to the other building.
reviews.title: Good Location, Lovely building, Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then they put us in a great room, with a lovely decoration, completly the opposite!
reviews.title: Gaudi-tastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: But the personal stuff are not helpfull, needer nicely.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and location, but....

likes.liked: — Great location, great rooms, menu looked good too but we ate out
likes.disliked: — Other than my silly shower seal that made a big mess, nothing! I'll gladly come again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfectly located for our purposes, being very close to tourist attractions but also in a safe upscale area away from the rowdy crowds on Ramblas.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our outward-facing room was located in a classical building, stylish as much of modern Barcelona, and roomy enough.
reviews.title: Good location but a poor value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: The hotel has a nice rooftop terrace, which must be very pleasant indeed in the summer. Even in the winter, it has great views over the city.
reviews.title: Fabulous location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It's a pity. I had stayed two years ago at this hotel, and returned because of its great location, in the Paseo the Gracia. But this time I found an uncomfortable room (small and a dowdy decoration) an equally uncomfortable bathroom (with old, frayed towels), all a poor value since the room cost more than $200. Also, the the service iwas very impersonal.
reviews.title: Condes de Barcelona --- great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I traveled alone to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday while she is studying abroad in Barcelona. Condes de Barcelona is only a few blocks from her school, so she stayed with me for the week I visited. While my daughter attended classes, I was in a perfect location to sight see, shop, and eat; thus, I was never bored. I also want to mention that Condes de Barcelona has a beautiful rooftop bar with a fantastic view of the city. The staff was exceptional and most helpful. I especially appreciated that everyone spoke English. Great experience!
reviews.title: Cannot Beat the Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could not fault this hotel for location, it is on the Passeig de Gracia which is a very busy road but we had a room overlooking the road and it was completely sound proofed, also a nice little balcony which we didn't expect. There were plenty of good restaurants within walking distance and if you want hustle and bustle the Plaza de Catalunya is approx 10mins walk. The hotel staff were distant but we didn't have a lot to do with them, our room was a good size and very clean. I would certainly return to this hotel, paid GBP80 per night through alpharooms
reviews.title: Great Location
Loved the hotel and location
reviews.text: We just got back from Spain. One of our favorite hotels was Condes de Barcelona. The location was fantastic! Beautiful, safe, yet close to the action. The hotel completely met our expectations. We had a smaller room, and I didn't find it crowded at all for two people.

reviews.title: Fabulous Stay - Very Welcoming
reviews.text: Only thing to be careful was booking on line. We didn't get a confirmation so we ended up booking twice. Be patient!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel. I am so glad that we didn't stay any closer to Las Ramblas.
reviews.title: Very Unwelcoming Staff - Downright unfriendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have to say what a wonderful stay my husband and i had at this hotel. We were originally told to check in after 2pm however as we had an early morning fllight we arrived just after 1130am and the staff were more than happy to take our suitcases to our rooms.
reviews.title: If You Like Service With A Smile...Skip TRhis Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007
reviews.text: Just come back from this great 4* hotel. As previews reviews have said this hotel has a great location not far from las Ramblas or all of Barcelona sites. We booked 3 rooms with Relaxabroad.com and paid £34 per person per night Room only which worked out cheaper than booking direct. We would recommend this hotel and have done to a number of our friends.
reviews.title: Fab hotel
Loved the Condes
reviews.text: We spent 4 days in Barcelona just before New Year. The Condes was excellent. We found the Hotel through Trip Advisor and the hotel met all our expectations. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Our 13 year old son stayed in the room with us comfortably. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. They gave us great restaurant recommendations. Our room had a great view of the Goudy house. The area around the hotel is upscale with great designer shops within walking distance. We would go back to this hotel without hesitation.

reviews.title: Dont plan to sleep in
reviews.text: The Condes is near most of the major Gaudi buildings, great shopping and restaurants, and a short walk to Ramblas and the Barrio Gotico. Clean and bright, our room had a great bed and a huge bathroom with one of the best showers I've ever used. The staff was not particularly helpful, but we didn't need much from them anyway. The room faced a side street, noisy with street life at night and then in the morning work crews arrive to start in on the numerous construction projects nearby, so dont plan to sleep late. Maybe the rooms that face the courtyard are quieter. We never ate at the hotel, as there were so many great and inexpensive dining options nearby. Viva el menu del dia: you can eat better and cheaper in this city (and in with Madrid) than anywhere else in Europe. Other than the noise, we had no complaints. Barcelona is a magical city and you won't want to waste your time sleeping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent hotel in a great location, very helpful, friendly staff. We had 3 rooms - all were well decorated and in a great part of the city. Perfect for the main shopping and tourist areas.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Barcelona

reviews.title: Everything was just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The price/benefit relationship of the hotel is unquestionable.
reviews.title: Roof Top Dining and Baroque Facade make for a unique experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel. I'll definitely stay there again
reviews.title: Great value but undersatffed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the fashionable shopping (and expensive shopping I might add) district on Passeig de Gràcia, the hotel's Spanish Baroque exterior (apparently a former private villa) invites guests for a special experience. You will enter trhough 3 meter high modern glass doors into a marble floored small reception area- with a winding staircase heading up to the second and third floors to the right of the reception area.
reviews.title: the devil is in the details...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception and concierge were very helpful with our group- booking restaurants and ensuring all was okay. My Room was in the main building- comfortable duvet covered twin beds, that I suppose could be pushed together- but I never tried it. Internet connections were fine- and the shower area was standard and adequate.
reviews.title: pleasant hotel in good position.
Disappionted
reviews.text: Recently booked a 4 night stay to celebrate my wife's birthday(Nov 11th-15th).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: LOCATION!LOCATION! LOCATION! Walk to all the sights- the Gaudi buildings, the Sagrada, the Plaza Catalunya, etc. Safe, lively, pretty area with restaurants, Tourist bus, etc.Helpful front desk staff.

description: The 4-Star Hotel Condes de Barcelona is ideally located on the Paseo de Gracia, in the heart of modernist Barcelona, opposite the famous Gaudi building, “La Pedrera”, a few minutes from Plaza Cataluña and the historic centre of the city. The hotel, which occupies two former nineteenth century palaces, offers 235 rooms and a catering service under the management of the chef Martín Berasategui, who holds three Michelin stars.The Hotel Condes de Barcelona is also renowned for its prestigious gastronomy under the management of Martín Berasategui. Berasategui advises and oversees all of the hotel’s restaurant services and his Restaurante Lasarte has two Michelin stars.For its exceptional location and the uniqueness of its spaces, it is the ideal setting to hold all types of events.
